meanings.definition: A row of shrubs or trees planted along a fence for boundary or decorative purposes.
meanings.sent1: The fencerows along the property line added a touch of green to the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden fence was lined with beautiful fencerows of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the fencerows as a secret path to sneak into the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts grew like fencerows, forming a protective barrier around her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The fencerows swayed gently in the breeze, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The act of planting or maintaining a row of shrubs or trees along a fence.
meanings.sent1: His job involved the careful upkeep of the fencerows to ensure they thrived.
meanings.sent2: Every spring, the community came together for a day of fencerows planting along the highway.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best-maintained fencerows in town was fierce and amusing.
meanings.sent4: She approached her problems with the precision of a gardener tending to fencerows.
meanings.sent5: The fencerows were a symbol of unity, each plant representing a member of the close-knit neighborhood.
